Module opentdk.gui
Package org.opentdk.gui.controls

Class ChoiceBox

java.lang.Object
org.opentdk.gui.controls.ChoiceBox
public class ChoiceBox extends Object
Dialog which allows to apply or skip an action, described by the content of the dialog. The user has the possibility to choose a value of a combo box and the result gets returned.

Example: 
 ChoiceBox box = new ChoiceBox(new Insets(20, 150, 10, 10), "OK", "Cancel");
 List<String> options = new ArrayList<>();
 options.add("A");
 options.add("B");
 Pair<ApplyOption, String> result = box.showChoiceBox("Title", "Info", options);
 System.out.println(result.get());
Author:
LK Test Solutions

  • Method Details

    • showChoiceBox

      public javafx.util.Pair<ChoiceBox.ApplyOption,String> showChoiceBox(String title, String header, List<String> options)
      Show a new apply dialog window. It gets closed after the user selection and button click.
      Parameters:
      title - title text of the dialog window
      header - content text of the dialog window
      options - possibilities that the user has in the dialog in a combo box
      Returns:
      javafx.util.Pair with the selected ApplyDialog as key and the selected value as string
